nodes.bodyText: There is a method hasAnnotation , no need to use getAnnotation.
Thanks. I didn't notice that one.

ClassNotFoundException  means there is no Polymer template in the classpath
NoSuchMethodException  means there is a mistake in the impl since polymer IS in the classpath but the method name used here doesn't match any method name in the module. It means that the method is either renamed or removed and this code has to be rewritten.
The catch should distinguish this two cases and ignore one case silently (log is enough) and do something more serious in the second case. May be just throw ISE since this is a mistake in the impl.
This is a good point. Added.

IllegalAccessException : can't happen. If it happens then this is an impl mistake and it should throw probably.
InvocationTargetException  means there was some exception in calling the method (which is wrapped to this one because of reflection call).
This exception may not be silently ignored (or just logged). It should be thrown somehow.
Throwing for each exception.

It might be that IllegalArgumentException is better here.
But I think it doesn't really matter.
